item.title: Books
item.description: Coming soon…

item.title: Resources
item.description:
Writing tools - The list of tools I use on a daily basis

Note: free | Freemium | paid.

1. Grammarly


Grammarly - No words to describe. The best tool out there.

I use Grammarly on a daily basis. It makes me looks like a smart ass. Of course, I am but even more.

Dev tools - The list of tools I use on a daily basis

Note: free | Freemium | paid.

1. Insomnia 3.0


Insomnia 3.0 - A simple and beautiful REST API client

This is by far my most preferred REST API client.

I am planning to write a blog post about the usage of this great tool. Please subscribe to this newsletter and I will notify with due respect when it’s ready and show you the fun things you can do with this tool.

2. SublimeText 3


SublimeText 3 - My go to code editor

This is my favourite code editor. I also use VSCode and VS2015.
VSCode - Second to none

3. iTerm2


iTerm2 - My love for iTerm2 is growing everyday

I ditched the Mac’s built-in terminal app and using iTerm2. I’m ing it.
